info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:52AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG SHOWERS WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON... WESTERN GREENE...NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA...NORTHEASTERN WETZEL... MARSHALL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM EDT... At 1051 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from near Cameron to Pine Grove. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cameron, Pine Grove, Hundred, Jacksonburg, Rogersville, Aleppo, Amity, New Freeport, Nineveh, Wileyville, Big Run, and Knob Fork. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 20 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
